input_text:
Extract aspects, sentiments, and rationales. Output format: aspect | sentiment | span | rationale | is_implicit | has_slang | has_emoji
Separate multiple aspects with ' ; '.

Example 1 (Explicit, Multi-aspect):
Text: Great food, slow service.
Output:
food | positive | Great food | User explicitly praises food quality. | FALSE | FALSE | FALSE ; service | negative | slow service | User explicitly complains about service speed. | FALSE | FALSE | FALSE

Example 2 (Slang + Emoji):
Text: ugh battery draining so fast ðŸ˜©
Output:
battery_life | negative | battery draining so fast | Explicit complaint about rapid battery drain with frustration emoji. | FALSE | TRUE | TRUE

Example 3 (Implicit - requires inference):
Text: scholarship funds embezzled and students lost tuition deposits completely
Output:
financial_oversight | negative | scholarship funds embezzled | Implicitly expresses negative sentiment about financial oversight via embezzlement, requiring inference that institutional controls failed. | TRUE | FALSE | FALSE ; student_protection | negative | students lost tuition deposits completely | Implicitly negative about student protection mechanisms via total financial loss. | TRUE | FALSE | FALSE

Example 4 (Multi-aspect with mixed signals):
Text: love the camera but battery life sucks ðŸ˜¤
Output:
camera | positive | love the camera | User explicitly expresses love for camera quality. | FALSE | FALSE | TRUE ; battery_life | negative | battery life sucks | User uses slang 'sucks' to express frustration with battery. | FALSE | TRUE | TRUE

Example 5 (Implicit atmosphere):
Text: This place is beautiful and perfect for dates.
Output:
ambiance | positive | beautiful and perfect for dates | Implicitly praises restaurant atmosphere through romantic suitability without naming 'ambiance'. | TRUE | FALSE | FALSE

Example 6 (Complex implicit with system failure):
Text: fire alarm system battery dead during blaze and owner skipped inspections
Output:
safety_compliance | negative | fire alarm system battery dead during blaze | Implicitly negative about safety compliance via life-critical equipment failure at emergency moment. | TRUE | FALSE | FALSE ; regulatory_adherence | negative | owner skipped inspections | Implicitly negative about regulatory adherence via deliberate inspection avoidance. | TRUE | FALSE | FALSE

Output:
target_text: microphone_quality | negative | The mic makes me sound like I'm underwater. | Implicit: 'makes me sound like I'm underwater' is a negative description of mic quality. | TRUE | FALSE | FALSE

Text: I go to a part 141 flight training program and they do stage checks. I've completed the private pilot program and am currently working on the instrument program. I have been unsat on 3 stage checks so far, but I haven't failed a Checkride. (I only took the ppl checkride so far and passed first try). My end goal is to work at the major airlines, but now I'm worried that none of them will accept me as a pilot because of these failures. Do any of you know if airlines even ask about these stage check failures and if it's already too late for me to try to pursue this career? Has anyone gone through similar situations? I've already committed so much into this career but is it even worth continuing if I don't have a chance at a job in the future? Also, with the way hiring is slowing down right now, I feel like you'd have to be the most perfect pilot in order to find a job these days. I'm still maybe 2 years out from applying for jobs, but the thought is stressing me out.
Output:
target_text: career_anxiety | negative | worried that none of them will accept me | explicitly uses 'worried that none of them will accept me' to express negative sentiment about career anxiety. | FALSE | FALSE | FALSE
